text: Watson Peak, is a mountain in the Solitude Range of the Hart Ranges in Northern British Columbia. Named for Canadian Army Private John G. Watson, from Bessborough, northwest of Dawson Creek, BC. Private Watson served with the Seaforth Highlanders when he was killed in action 17 September 1944, age 23 in Italy. Pte. Watson is buried at Coriano Ridge War Cemetery. == References == Category:Mountain ranges of British Columbia Category:Northern Interior of British Columbia Category:Canadian Army soldiers Category:Dawson Creek
title: Watson Peak (British Columbia)
